basic_information.scholarship_name: Dean's Scholarship Award for the College of Fine Arts and Design
basic_information.scholarship_notes: The CFAD Dean chooses two top picks from each department and the Arts Administration program. The Donor Panel then chooses the Dean's Award recipient from those top choices. The remaining #1 choices from each dept and Arts Administration program receive a Dean's Recognition award of lesser value.
basic_information.college_name: College of Fine Arts and Design

description: Established in 2007, this scholarship is open to upper-level students of the UCO College of Fine Arts and Design who demonstrate high academic achievement, distinctive artistry and distinguishing leadership and character. This scholarship is considered our highest scholarship honor. Recipient must possess a high level of artistry in your area of discipline and demonstrate leadership, personal achievement, integrity and character. Eligibility Any CFAD major Cumulative GPA 3.5+ Junior, senior or graduate student Enrolled full time (12+ hours undergraduate, 9+ hours graduate) Requirements Two faculty references Personal artist statement (250 words) Official transcript

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship

criteria.description: SIS_College is Fine Arts and Design   or SIS_College_2 is Fine Arts and Design
criteria.raw_text: SIS_College is Fine Arts and Design   or SIS_College_2 is Fine Arts and Design
